frame.name: Competition
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame is concerned with the idea that people (<fen>Participant_1</fen>, <fen>Participant_2</fen>, or <fen>Participants</fen>) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the <fen>Competition</fen>) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the <fen>Prize</fen>). <fen>Rank</fen> and <fen>Score</fen> are different criteria by which the degree of achievement of the advantageous outcome is judged.
<ex><fex name="Participants">He and I</fex> <t>played</t> <fex name="Competition">tennis</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Participant_1
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the first (or only) participant in a competition. <ex><fex name="Participant_1">Jo</fex> <t>played</t> the lottery every day.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Participant_2
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the second participant in a competition. <ex>Jo <t>played</t> <fex name="Participant_2">Leslie</fex> at tennis.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participants
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for plural NP participants in a competition. <ex><fex name="Participants">Jo and Leslie</fex> <t>played</t> tennis.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Competition
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the name of the competition. <ex>Jo <t>played</t> <fex name="Comp">in the foosball tournament</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Score
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the score in a game. <ex>The Yankees won the game <fex name="Score">2 to 0</fex>.</ex> EX: The Yankees won the game <fex name="Score">by two points</fex>.</def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the ranked results of a competition, and is translatable into a numerical value. <ex>Jo came in <fex name="Rank">third</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Prize
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates a prize won in a competition. <ex>John was <t>competing</t> <fex name="Prize">for a bronze medal</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Venue
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition. <ex>The Mets will play <fex name="Venue">at the ball park</fex> on Sunday.</ex> <ex>The Mets will play <fex name="Venue">at Shea Stadium</fex> tonight.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>Where the event takes place. A constituent tagged as <fen>Place</fen> may require annotation on a secondary FE-layer. <ex>First layer: John's first <t>competition</t> <fex name="Place">at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.</ex> <ex>Second layer: John's first <t>competition</t> <fex name="Competition">at Wimbledon</fex> astonished the crowd.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>The action the <fen>Participants</fen> (or <fen>Participant_1</fen>) are involved in that constitutes a <fen>Competition</fen>.
<ex>They <t>played</t> <fex name="Means">by seeing who could get the ball to the far side of the parking lot</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The period of time when the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used to describe the length of time over which competition occurs. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used to describe the intended outcome of the competition. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the intensity of competition.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE expresses how often the <fen>Competition</fen> occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: concurrent.n
lexUnit.definition: met wie men strijdt om hetzelfde doel

lexUnit.name: tegenstander.n
lexUnit.definition: die tegen iets of iemand vecht of zich verzet

lexUnit.name: rivaal.n
lexUnit.definition: die hetzelfde probeert te bereiken als de persoon in kwestie en daardoor een bedreiging voor hem of haar vormt
